The on ramp enters into a surprisingly welcoming hallway. Aside from the occasional table and couch bolted to the floor, only the doors to the various quarters lie here, with stairs leading to the deck below.
ShwiggityShwah 21-Aug-19 12:14 PM
Cassius awaits his adventurers, hands behind his back. "If you please, wait here a moment, I need to make sure your rooms are ready. Please, take the time to introduce yourselves to eachother and begin establishing rapport"
With that, Cassius begins to turn and walk down one of the hallways.
The doors in the hall are all locked tight. The stairwells appear open as Clay disappears out of view, heading downstairs. (edited)
Gent 21-Aug-19 12:15 PM

He has already introduced himself to most of the people before, so he didn't feel like having to be the first one to start a conversation with all the others. He simply looked at them, waiting for the first one to talk up

Lee Jackson 21-Aug-19 12:55 PM
Carric having arrived on board after everyone else looked around and realised that nobody was talking so he decided it was a perfect opportunity to start a conversation. "So everybody what type of requests do you think that this here collective of adventurers should acquire or should we simply peruse the available options first?" asked the Elf. He did want a job that was both helpful, had knowledge for him to learn and paid well but he was curious as to what the others wanted to take on as well.
Winds of Hope 21-Aug-19 02:44 PM
Along came Opal, stressing herself out by scurrying into the hall as fast as she could. Finally arrived, she comes to a slowed, panting stop against the couch. "Ha... ha... ha... probably... ones we can... use our-" she swallows deep to help steady herself "-use our wide number of people to tackle multiple things at once." She slumps against the couch, resting her head on its cushion with half-closed eyes.
Omnissiah 21-Aug-19 02:56 PM
Crucitus had entered a few moments earlier, and was peering about the entrance hall with wide eyes. He had an odd habit of tilting his head from one side to the other as he appraised his surroundings. “Where would we look to see what our options are?” he asked absent-mindedly.
Gent 21-Aug-19 03:00 PM

I'm not sure how much we can trust him yet though... I guess we will just need to watch our backs while sleeping..."
Winds of Hope 21-Aug-19 03:04 PM
Opal frowns and stands up straight, "d-don't say something like that. He's probably just... eccentric..." She looks away quickly and turns back to the couch, lifting herself up after a hop-hop and turning to face the three of them.
Omnissiah 21-Aug-19 03:08 PM
Crux turned to face them, finally focusing his blazing gaze on the pair. "Unless you have a very unique anatomy, watching your back while sleeping would seem to be a doomed enterprise," he mused.
Lee Jackson 21-Aug-19 03:13 PM
Carric calmly spoke, "When one lacking conscious, you lack the visual means to survey your environment. But I have the solution. A spell that alerts whenever an intruder intrudes upon one's vicinity. And given time I am able to cast it infinitely." (edited)
Gent 21-Aug-19 03:15 PM
he soon pointed over at Carric before speaking again "See? Some of us are smart enough to have solutions for things like this..." he then lowered his hand, soon continuing "But I was rather thinking about some of you guys sleeping in the same room, to make sure that nobody will get attacked in their sleep... Just a thought..."
Omnissiah 21-Aug-19 03:20 PM
Crux's hair flared at Lucas's insult, spitting sparks onto the floor as his eyes flashed with concerning intensity. His angry expression soon subsided, replaced by simple annoyance. "If he wanted us dead, we already would be. Getting killed isn't my concern... There are fates worse than death." He turned to smile at Opal, a friendly and familiar face in an unfamiliar setting. "But anyways, let's look for those opportunities he mentioned!" His rumbling bass tone was filled with excitement and enthusiasm all of a sudden.
Winds of Hope 21-Aug-19 03:28 PM

Lee Jackson 21-Aug-19 03:40 PM
Well Carric decided to have a closer look around the hallway to see if he could find anything that contained writing of any sort. If there was rules or instructions or even job listings somewhere in this hallway he wanted to read them to try and understand his predicament better.
ShwiggityShwah 21-Aug-19 03:47 PM
@Lee Jackson What luck, there is a #old-job-board found at the end of the hall, ready for review. No other info about the ship though.
Lee Jackson 21-Aug-19 03:51 PM
Carric having noticed the job board tells the others, "Well for those who are interested I have discerned a job board at the extremity of the hallway. Maybe we should peruse it to help aid us in our resolution of job selection." He then walked up to the board to read the jobs that was available there but leaving room for others to see it as well. He then waited to gauge every one else's reactions to the jobs currently available.
Gent 21-Aug-19 03:54 PM
Lucas followed Carric shortly after he went over to the jobs board, looking around at first to make sure everyone else seemed interested in it or not. He soon started browsing the jobs, being a little happy that they didn't seem too hard at all... "Hmm... The first two seem easy enough to do... But I think we need to practice some more before the third one... Hey, I can't see a timelimit on these though... Do you think we can just take them in order without them disappearing?"
Omnissiah 21-Aug-19 03:55 PM
Crucitus’s ears perked up at Carric’s words, and the living flame of a man swiftly dashed down the hall after him. “Interesting... Very interesting.” He extended a finger and tapped the paper marked “Job 2”, accidentally setting the corner on fire. After swiftly blowing it out, he flashed a nervous smile. “I think we should do that one. No need to dive into dangerous territory immediately, but that doesn’t mean we should waste our time with trifles either.” (edited)
ShwiggityShwah 21-Aug-19 04:28 PM
The paper reformed slowly... bit by bit until it was whole again. Interesting little enchantment...
Lee Jackson 21-Aug-19 05:12 PM
Carric was very intrigued by the enchanted paper, he should definitely ask about that as he would probably be taking a lot of notes between adventures and having such paper would be convenient. But of course he had his preferences for the jobs. What interested him the most was the fact that one of the jobs offered potions as part of the reward. While he would still need to raise more money to buy the special inks needed to transfer spells into his spell book, hopefully at least one of the potions might contain a spell that he would be able to copy in his spell book. If not then he could either use them if they were useful or sell them if he had no need of them. Plus he might be able to learn something from the alchemist. He tapped the paper that had job one on it while saying, "Personally this one would be my first selection. It sounds like there is the most to learn at that job and receiving potions as recompense is never an adverse commodity after all. But I would also feel satisfactory with job two as well."
BadWolf 21-Aug-19 07:31 PM
Cyra moved gracefully down the hall where the group had congegrated. Her hips swayed back and fourth in a salacious long sride, her perky ass flexing while taking each step. She stopped as she gave the job board a long look over, tapping her index finger againsr her chin. "hmmm, I think that job 2 sounds both challenging and achievable..." She smiled warmly, placing her hands behind her back, her large chest pressing out from her posture. The two mounds squeezed together, drawing attention to her overflowing cleavage.
Winds of Hope 21-Aug-19 07:36 PM
Opal eventually made her way over to the board, squinting as she looks at the board from far below. "Um," she puffs her cheeks out a little bit frustrated and decides to drop her bag, standing on it but still squinting, "I guess two is fine? I think? Can't really see it that well, b-but I'll be willing to help with whatever is believed to be possible!" (edited)
drogn 21-Aug-19 07:39 PM
Laurentia observed the job board in silence, having followed Carric. Reading and weighing the positive and negative aspects of each job internally, she hummed under her breath, her gloves fingers tapping her inner forearm. Tapping job two, she spoke, her voice rough, but pleasantly so. "The monetary value is higher for this job, and it seems to be considerably easier. I would choose this second job." As Cyra approached, Laurentia gave her a single look, before returning to the board. "Job 2 is my choice. I will, of course, acquiesce to the decision of the majority." Looking around, surveying her companions, she clapped twice. "I'm sure most of us are somewhat acquainted with one another, but I believe it would be prudent to go through introductions."
Omnissiah 21-Aug-19 07:41 PM
"I believe the majority has reached the decision. That's three votes for Job 2." Crucitus turned to glance at all the others who were present, looking to see if there were any objections with going forward to the aforementioned objective.
Lee Jackson 21-Aug-19 07:48 PM
Carric quickly corrected Crucitus, "Well we are indeed taking Job 2 if it is only us six voting. Four have voted for job 2, one has voted for job 1 and one has technically not picked but implied to do either job 1 or job 2. But your conclusion is still accurate. Now we just need to await the re-emergence of the guild master."

ShwiggityShwah 21-Aug-19 07:57 PM
CRRRRAAAASSSHHHH CLANG CONG "GRAH!!!" THUMP The sound of metal hammering against metal echoes across the ship. A gutterial raspy scream is heard mixed into the cacophony. More bangs ring sharply until there was a heavy thump against the deck. The estute among them swore that mixed into the blunt force was the keen of something sharp scraping against jagged scrap iron. Then there is silence. Only the awkward thrum of the engines keeping the ship aloft.
Omnissiah 21-Aug-19 07:58 PM

BadWolf 21-Aug-19 08:03 PM

drogn 21-Aug-19 08:05 PM
Hearing the commotion, Laurentia cracked her neck, a soft smile upon her lips The hem of her coat swished around her ankles as she turned. Unbuttoning her coat, Laurentia moved towards the couch, reclining against the wall Her open coat revealed her lithe, slender form, her pert, well formed breasts, and the array of ammunition strapped to her thighs and hips, as well as two strange contraptions. Wearing a crimson shirt beneath her coat, the tight fabric outlining her body, Laurentia uncorked a copper hipflask, drinking deep. (edited)
Winds of Hope 21-Aug-19 08:07 PM
With alert reflex, Opal disappears to any who takes their eyes off her to look at the direction of the sound. Letting go of Laurentia's hand, she nimbly darts around the legs of the cleric while everyone's distracted by the sound. When the sound finally ceases, any who happens to look down at Cyra's legs would see the halfling leaning her head just barely out to take a peak around the room, hands lightly gripped on Cyra's legs. BadWolf 21-Aug-19 08:19 PM
She reflexively moved into a defensive posture upon feeling the small hands against her firm calf, she was a protector and her instincts drove her to move slightly infront of Opal. She focused on her senses, her eyes darting back and fourth down the hall. She heard a 'ding' sound from the airship, making her brow raise up in uncertainty. Was the ship... ready? She held her shield slightly infront of her, blocking Opal from danger. Avrae BOT 22-Aug-19 10:20 AM
Carric Amastacia casts Shield!
Carric Amastacia
Effect: Shield [until start of next turn] (AC: +5)
Effect
An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.
Spell Slots
1 ◉◉〇〇

Avrae BOT 23-Aug-19 01:40 AM
Carric Amastacia casts Shield!
Carric Amastacia
Effect: Shield [until start of next turn] (AC: +5)
Effect
An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.
Spell Slots
1 ◉〇〇〇

And things did not sound good. Deciding to get her bearings, she made her way into a nearby closet, peering from behind the door, taking in the sight that was unfolding before her.

He then glanced to the side, looking down the hallway, looking towards some of the other rooms that he didn't think were in use before looking back at her, his light, misterious but charming smile never disappearing from his face "I think that most of the rooms that are empty could do the trick... What do you think?" his voice seemed a little lower than his usual speaking voice while he was talking to her in common the whole time, knowing it fully well that none of the others could hear him at the moment

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 27-Aug-19 12:08 PM
Anariel nodded, her silvery hair falling in front of her face. The eladrin pushed it back, tucking it behind a pointed ear, as she looked up at her newfound companion, her face feeling hot, while small goose bumps formed along her skin. Slipping easily back into thieves’ cant, she then reached out to gently touch Lucas’ arm. She felt a small jolt at the slight contact. It was pleasant though still rather surprising. “This place will be difficult to map,” she informed him, her words strange to anyone who didn’t know the language of thieves and scoundrels. “This place is either cursed or protected,” she explained. “The inside is not as it seems.” She tilted her head, a tiny frown tugging at her lips. “The ship is bigger on the inside, the pathways ever changing.” Her frown only grew. “Parcival led the way to the treasury and back,” she continued. “And it was impossible to gain one’s bearings at all. What I noted on the way there was suddenly made anew upon leaving.” She was still rather bothered by this bit of strange magic, her desire to understand the ship and its crew only growing. “Perhaps if we mark the way on the ship’s walls or floors...” she continued, though her voice began to trail. “But we can try,” she said. “Best we watch out for Parcival though,” she then said matter of factly. “I don’t trust him. And he seems to enjoy using trickery.”

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 27-Aug-19 02:56 PM

When it became too difficult to hold his gaze, she averted her eyes and let out a soft sound indicating she rather liked hearing such compliments. His voice was soothing to her ear, a nice timbre that seemed to hold her attention. “Thank you, Sir,” Anariel replied in thieves’ cant, her voice soft and low, that husky tone returning. Once again, Lucas was rewarded with that formality, that unintentional title that seemed so easy to say to him. She wasn’t entirely sure why this man made her react in such ways—perhaps it was the common bond they shared or that smile, the sound of his voice as he addressed her. But try as she might, she couldn’t help it. His smile made her warm and that look made her tremble, her knees suddenly feeling weak beneath her. Yes. It was all she could do just to keep her thoughts in order. “Yes, it’ll be shorter,” Anariel agreed. “But it’s a start,” she went on, second guessing herself for the very first time since her guardian’s passing. “For now.” The eladrin gave Lucas a sweet smile, ready to follow him on an adventure throughout the halls of the airship.

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 27-Oct-19 08:53 PM
Irithriel’s face was bright with a smile, her cheeks rosy and her gray eyes glittering happily. “Pleasure to meet you all,” she said sweetly, her hand reaching for Mors’. An entertainer!” The elf suddenly clapped and twirled, her thin filmy gown fanning out from her body. “I sing and play a variety of instruments. I dance...” It was obvious the girl was excited. “In fact...” Her expression became mischievous, her smile growing. “You will be one of the judges for the upcoming event!” Her smile suddenly turned into a sweet little pout. “Why didn’t Mr Clay introduce you sooner. Hmph!” Irithriel took a step back and looked up at Mors. “We do have a Winter Festival coming up soon, as you know. I need judges. Won’t May be splendid, my beast?” Again, the pretty elf giggled with excitement, her hand once more finding Mors’. “Oh, it’ll be wonderful fun! Do you prefer dance or music?” she asked, practically bouncing at Mors’ side, her thin gown tugging at her body, showing off every curve and leaving little to the imagination. It was clear the girl had no idea that so much could still be seen despite the flimsy gown covering her body. “You will all attend the festival, yes?” Iri then asked of the others. She hoped they all would. The cold and dreary weather seemed to be taking its toll on many and she’d asked Mr Clay if she could plan an event to help boost the spirits of all. The skeleton man had approved of her desire, granting it without hesitation. Now she was eager to get others involved, to see smiles and hear laughter. “It will be wonderful! I’m excited to see everyone share their talents.”

"A dancer should dance, Let those who appreciate the are be the judges. The more dancers there are the better anyways, wouldnt that be right?" His hands slid down to Coppers, holding them gently as he tries to manuever out of her grip. A quick peck on her hand as thanks. "I have not heard of such an event, we're all relatively new. But i am thankful it exists, i'll happily attend."

Coal 29-Oct-19 12:42 PM

The Raven stopped perching, crouching in as it got itself comfortable and rested itself against May. "I was not born, I was created. A wizard named Rasmus, one of the most powerful beings I have ever met, created me. He used to be an adventurer and being exactly like him except in personality and memories (just memories, same personality) I had a lot of problems thrust upon me. With his name, people showered me with praise but It also came with many enemies when used. It wasn't so difficult to find an area that didn't know his name. Most adventurers end up lost to time anyways. But... it took a while before I could just run about with dangerous enemies tailing after me." (edited)
1
YCLM 29-Oct-19 01:04 PM
May looked at the bird with no words. She blinked a few times her eyes getting wider with each opening of them. She couldn’t believe a single word of it but they seemed convinced that is what happened. She stayed silent as to not interrupt before patting the birds head taking her nails and slightly straightening a few feathers. Her mind wondered gulping slightly. “Well at least you have some type of reputation without having to work for it but you could just change the name and settle down into a normal life.”
Coal 29-Oct-19 01:07 PM
"People know the face just as well, I'd have to take on a whole different persona and how would I go about that? Like..."
YCLM 29-Oct-19 01:16 PM
“Easiest I have seen is face paint. I do it for my more... unconventional dancing jigs. Plus I would do it as a child in our festival gathering in town. No one could tell the difference till all of us starting dancing.”
Coal 29-Oct-19 01:22 PM
"I don't need face paint. The problem stems is his face is the most imbued into my memory."
YCLM 29-Oct-19 01:33 PM
”Oh.” She went silent not knowing really what to say shrugging slightly. She ruffled her hair slightly trying to think of anything to say in response. “I ront think i am the one to help you. I dont daddle with that stuff and not to good with advice.” She felt so awkward and shifting around.
Coal 29-Oct-19 01:39 PM
"What do you mean you don't dabble? You've been casting a lot of spells, heck you tracked me through my illusion with magic. And I for one am thankful for your advice." Bird nuzzles into her chest, resting on her belly and all. "I do need to change my appearance. To what, I suppose I'll have to find out on my own."
YCLM 29-Oct-19 01:43 PM
May laughed her stomach slightly bouncing with the action. “Me casting spells do you see me walking around with a wand and going Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo no I don’t do magic magic’s not real remember? What in your mind made you think that I cast a spell when I just figured out which one of you guys were real I just got lucky that’s it.” She stated like it was absolute fact and that there was no room for any questions she honestly didn’t think she cast a spell and would stand by that till the day she was proven wrong.
Coal 29-Oct-19 01:46 PM

YCLM 29-Oct-19 01:58 PM
"I meant to hush you up without it looking like I was. That stuff hurts trust me I have done it before to myself. You dont wish to be find out but you were announcing to everyone we were adventures and stuff. I do not wish to be associated with that. I do not wish to argue but I will not budge on my belief of what I believe."
Coal 29-Oct-19 02:03 PM
"Okay... I guess I could see that. From my perspective, it seemed like you were doing it as a way to say no. You didn't want to be friends. It really hurt me. I mean, at times I can seriously like you."
YCLM 29-Oct-19 02:12 PM
"Don't get your hopes up. I was never one to be bedded down to one person. My brother was the one everyone thought would get married and settle down. I was not a wild child but I have bigger ambitions then to stay in one place so relationships romantic or platonic were short lived always. I see you as s good companion but dont use the friend word to describe my self with others." She picked at her nails absent mindedly. She sighed looked down to the bird. "Don't take it personally. Just part of the job is all. No town wants the same dancer for years on end and well dont age quickly so some get bored of my look not changing."
Coal 29-Oct-19 02:15 PM

YCLM 02-Nov-19 01:11 PM
Stellar came back from the bath still drying his long gnarly hair in his resting clothes. His body suit slightly damp from his bath. His hood and cloak on pulled up minding his busniess going to unlock his door shoving door open and leaving it open as he bomb dived for the bed sighing contently.
Deleted User 02-Nov-19 01:13 PM
Jack glanced in at Stellar, not knowing who Stellar was or what they were doing. "Are you alright?" He asked politely, not knowing what else to say. His head almost touching the top of the doorframe from his tall stature.
YCLM 02-Nov-19 01:19 PM
Stellar jerked up out of his bed on his feet in a instant. He bared his teeth a bit eyes blown out wide at suddenly being startled by the looming figure as he was very small elf with next to no muscle mass. Hissing he scrambled up to his weapon hand on it to show he was not afraid to attack if threatened. "Fine." He seemed to relax as he responded straightening up his incidental fear ebbing away.
Deleted User 02-Nov-19 01:23 PM
Jack stood, obviously confused at the little elf man. Jack didn't know what to expect or say out of that. He stood there as if Stellar were an oddity among anyone else he had seen on the Ship. "You're fine, eh mate?" He said, his loud Irish/Australian accent booming through the halls and rooms. Jack hadn't even rested his hand on his weapon, even knowing he is paranoid he'll be attacked at all times. Stellar hadn't even been that threatening, Jack was in shock due to Stellar's little size and bravery to draw on Jack.
YCLM 02-Nov-19 01:30 PM
Allowing his hand to drop from the weapon he tugged his cloak closer around his tiny frame. rolling his shoulders before trying to puff up as big as he could. "I am fine." His voice was gruff and worn not use to talking or being talked to. His wild main of blood red drying and puffing up even bigger clearly back from bath. "You spooked me most avoid me like a illithid."
Deleted User 02-Nov-19 01:31 PM
He shrugged "I don't really avoid people, are you alright though?" He asked politely, hoping to see if Stellar WAS alright.
YCLM 02-Nov-19 01:38 PM
Stellar nodded his head in a yes manner still doing his little puffed up tiptoed dance Jack's size quiet daunting to his smaller size. It wasnt anything personal he did it to every one a bit of a bristly fellow. "Are you?" He coughed clearing his throat. "You seem to have been wandering and I am surprised you have not been warned of what do they call them? My antics."
Deleted User 02-Nov-19 01:41 PM
He shrugged once more. "Quite tired. But yes, I am fine. I wander to clear my dark thoughts fairly often. If I see someone who may need help... Well.... You get the point." He glanced, taking a look inside Stellar's room. Looking back over at Stellar. "Why are you puffing up your shoulders and chest, little one?" Jack asked, obviously in a state of confusion.
Jack tilted his head, cracking his neck and making a loud and obnoxious pop.
YCLM 02-Nov-19 01:49 PM
Stellar's room was barren despite him living here for a while. A single clothes pile for washing and a single pile on other side of room for clean. The weapons on his dresser and a bag in the corner all there was to see. He lived off the basics. "I am not! I am not little! I am old enough to be your great grandfather!" He defended himself puffing up more so due to the insult. He hisses at the end of his sentence slightly before jumping back at the sound face crunching up. He looked like a little bunny hopping around at any loud sound or movement.
Deleted User 02-Nov-19 01:52 PM
He shrugged "Alright, well, I best get on with my day. I still yet have to do..." Jack pulled out a piece of paper with a list on it. Some things checked off, others not. "I still half to clean my room, take a bath, eat, have some leisurely time, and sleep." He sighed "Your name is? I am Jack." He asked, stepping out of the doorway.

[in case you didn't know what those are it is Agape- Unconditional love, meaning a selfless kind of love Eros- romantic love, feelings you would have for a lover Philia- Affectionate love, the love you feel for your friends Philautia- self love, self explanitory Storge- Familiar love, the love you feel for your family Pragma- Enduring Love, a mature version of Eros which isn't necessarily sexual Ludus- Playful love, basically the honeymoon stage of love, where you're just full of butterflies and such Mania- Obsessive love, a perversion of love which can lead to anger, jealousy or even madness]

Garg stops laughing and shakes his head, just look at him, talking instead of trying to scare the shit out of her, Meh, fuck you kraken... "Ha! What happened last time?! I bet you were whoring.... My bad, sharing your love and the poor bastard got turned into fucking barbeque!! Ha!"
Berry 30-Nov-19 11:18 AM
At the question, Ena’s body language turned to that of discomfort. “I.. Would rather not talk about it.” For the first time during the conversation she looked sad, maybe a bit of shame on her face, her warm eyes looking away for a moment before she regained her composure. “Any other questions you’d like to ask?”

The girl looked back at the men and smiled. Already she had a good feeling about this newcomer. He didn’t hesitate in offering his assistance, nor did he seem interested in payment, though she’d make sure he got his fair share. It was refreshing to know there were people out there who just wanted to help. And to think some were right in her very own guild. She felt so very fortunate for that.

ShwiggityShwah 10-Dec-19 09:35 AM
Copper Pearl had seen another group of hopefuls for the rescue mission, namely Pox the Kenku, and Opal @Winds of Hope the snake woman essentially had snuck up on them. Copper was already admidst a discussion. "Hey there cuties! Would you mind helping little ol me?" She said, her hands together and tail waggling. Pox looked up at her, head tilting. "Snake lady." She chirped. "Pox need to find roost. What snake lady need help with?" "Please." She held up a hand expecting them to kiss it. "Princess Copper Pearl." Pox mimiced her and spoke, her voice coming out in a repeat. "Princess Copper Pearl." Copper seemed disturbed. "I dont sound like that, are you making fun of me?" "Uhh. Pox dont know. Pox like fun!" Copper pouted. "Im not going to stand here and be insulted by a bird that parrots her own name!" "Copper not standing. Youre slithering." There was obviously a disconnect here...
ShwiggityShwah 10-Dec-19 03:46 PM

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Dec-19 03:53 PM
Quite a gathering was occurring and it warmed Irithriel’s heart. She hoped several would want to help her look for Mors and, most importantly, bring him back home to the Steel Hearts. She missed him desperately, her heart aching ever since Primal Point. She just hoped that when they left to go find him, that they’d all return together. Unscathed. And safe. “Pox?” Iri then muttered, the strange bird like creature unfamiliar to her entirely. “Nice to meet you as well,” she went on before curtsying, as was her habit to do so. “This is Warden and Jonny. My name is Irithriel. Please, call me Iri.”
ShwiggityShwah 10-Dec-19 04:19 PM

Warden is almost rolling on the floor laughing at the exchange between the two. Phantom is just being a deep and looking back and forth between the two interesting looking people. Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 01:40 AM
Irithriel bit down on her lower lip, as Pox spoke. It was rather unnerving how this strange bird made sounds that completely did not match the other... sounds that also resembled her own voice. The elf shuddered, a chill running down along her spine. How she wished her Mors was there... hopefully soon she could look in his eyes once more, feel his arms about her, here his voice as he called to her... ‘little moon’... Suddenly, Phantom made a strange whimpering sound and ran off. Iri had noticed the sweet dog had been sniffing at Pox. Warden immediately ran after his dog, giving the girl a start. “Oh... I...” She looked at the bird sheepishly, though even she couldn’t deny the strange chill. “Warden!” she called out. “Wait!” Her hands reaches out to try and stop him. But she was so much smaller than the large goliath. Looking to both Jonny and Copper, she gestured that they go after him. “What’s gotten into Phantom?” Iri asked. “Let’s help Warden retrieve him. We all have much to discuss.”
Warden - Nathan - Alor 11-Dec-19 03:29 AM
Warden leans over his shoulder and waves Iri off a bit "I got this. Dont worry about me. Do what you need to do. Hes my pup! He probably just needs to go to the bathroom. I'll find you all later!" He offers a smile and turns back to where Phantom had ran off to, his smile fading. He knew something was wrong but didnt know exactly what it was. His friend didnt react like this unless it was something truly terrible for him. As he runs he casts speak with animals and starts calling out to him in beast tongue. Phantom just looks over and keeps running (edited)
ShwiggityShwah 11-Dec-19 10:01 AM
Copper smiled, her other hand gracing her chest as she grinned. "What a gentleman, and so big." She flirted. She fluttered her eyes as she looked up at him, hers seeming to shimmer slightly. She snaps her fingers and the smell of perfume fills the air. "I love a man with titles. I have some too. We should compare sometime." Pox seems to chirp happily. "Always fun with new friends." She responds. ------------ After the incident. Copper crosses her arms and harumphs. "See little bird creep is creepy. Never trust someone a dog doesnt trust." Pox looks... confused. "Pox just took bath. Uuurk why dogs no like Pox?" "Cause youre a creep." "And Copper is snake." She responds reflexively. She addresses the group. "Pox is kenku. Kenku not liked. Pox used to it. No blame friends if not like Pox. Help anyway." She made a little thumbs up. (edited)
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 11:38 AM
Irithriel just nodded, as Warden went after Phantom. Her gray eyes lingered a moment, another chill running down along her spine. She turned back towards the others—Copper, Jonny... Pox. She wasn’t sure why the strange bird made her feel uneasy. She didn’t want to reiterate Copper’s choice of words, as she didn’t find them entirely fair. But there was something. She just didn’t know what. Trying to move past the sudden uneasiness, Iri gave everyone a smile. “Well, I’m so glad all of you are willing and wanting to help me find Mors.” She looked to Jonny then. “He’s a goliath just like you,” she said, her face flushing a bit as her thoughts drifted to her beloved. Realizing she’d begun to daydream, Iri giggled then and asked aloud, “Does anyone know of a healer who might aid us?” That was all they needed now before they all ventured forth for Primal Point.

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 07:24 PM
Irithriel heard a new voice and turned, her snowy curls swishing about her pretty face. She saw the newcomer and, per habit, curtsied. “Hello,” she said sweetly, giving him a smile. “You’ve heard correctly. Mors is my love, my mate. He... he was taken from me back at Primal Point and I must find him and bring him back home.” The pretty elf began to tear up just a bit. Sniffling, she then dabbed at her eyes. “So, if you’re willing to help, they we are grateful to have you. Thank you so very much.”
Ippo 11-Dec-19 07:43 PM
Riwo seems sympathetic to Irithriel's plight, and he holds out a white handkerchief to her by the end of his tail. "There, there. It's no trouble, dear. It is my pleasure to help with such things."
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Dec-19 07:47 PM
Irithriel nodded and smiled, gratitude etched in her brow. “Well, it means a lot to me. Knowing my guild mates wish to help in a time of need like this. I...” The girl’s chest tightened. For once she was being thought of as silly or a nuisance. Others wanted to help, to surround her with support and encouragement. It had been so different back in the Feywild. And she knew her Mors would be pleased that so many seemed to be looking out for her, while he could not. But she hoped to remedy that. And sooner than later. “I’m just so very grateful. Now that we’re all in agreement to face the jungles of Primal Point, perhaps we should ready ourselves for this mission. I fear it will be a difficult one.”

I’m unsure what sorts of beasts linger there, but it seems to be home to a tribe of goliaths. Our charge had to beat one. And I was told to return if I wanted my Mors and.... oh, I do so very desperately!” She looked at everyone, hoping what information she knew might help. “The baths?” Iri then asked, her brow arching in confusion.

After everything... Rose and Edgar got themselves sorted. Rose has wanted the ranger to meet Garg anyway and now? Well, now he had to. Avrae BOT 12-Jan-20 01:56 AM
Siobhan 25-Jan-20 03:09 AM
Somewhere in the endless maze of the ship—a quality she was not fond of—Nar al Jahim, Yoke of the Hells, was having a simply lovely time. She had, naturally, tracked down the largest quarters available, in the same wing as most of the goliaths but a few decimeters wider because of a quirk of closet placement. And a lavish carpet of aromatic smoke was currently seeping out under the door, drifting erratically in time with the sitar notes coming from the other side. It had been going on like this for nearly an hour when the music stopped mid-way through a measure. Some fifteen seconds passed in silence, and then the door swung open hard. Nar, having kept hold of the latch, let its momentum spin her out into the hall, tail sweeping after her feet in a wide helix. The cloud that followed her out whirled in tight eddies that blew down the hall when she pushed the door closed with a hip. It smelled of jasmine. She closed her eyes and smiled—it might have been meditative if she weren't bobbing in the suggestion of a dance—then started walking in the direction opposite the smoke.
Ippo 25-Jan-20 09:57 AM
With a much less graceful and meditative energy, something angry stomps through the halls, until around the corner comes a small pink ball of ponytails and muscle. Pixie's face is a deeper color than even her hair, and her cheeks are puffed in indignation. When she sees Nar, and sniffs the air for the strange smells, she directs her stomping at her. Pointing a small finger at Nar, Pixie says, "'Ey! You! Where am I? What's that weird smell?"
LordHavelock 25-Jan-20 02:47 PM
Zechs was pouring through journals and reports obtained from the library whilst heading back to his own quarters. Rather a roundabout route, out of habit with his healthy paranoia. It was so when he nearly bumped into Nar while she was facing the opposite direction. Where others in the halls he had been able to deftly and reflexively move between and around, the relatively sudden and quite imposing figure of the Asmodean wasn't something he was expecting, or prepared for. Looking up form his journal at the daunting figure before him, already turning to face who had emerged from the cloud of smoke, a different sort of reflex asserted itself and the lithe changeling immediately began to shift. It wasn't much of a change, still appearing roughly as himself, but Zechs now sported a dull sienna skintone and a pair of sloping regal horns sprouting from his temples. He'd practiced a generalized guise as a tiefling, reverting back to it now in the presence of the rather imposing individual filling the hallway. Hearing a voice which was most definitely not belonging to the woman in front of him, Zechs leaned to one side to spy the rather indignant halfling making accusations. "Why would jasmine be strange to you?" He asked, somewhat pointedly before taking a step back and stowing the various leatherbound books into his satchel.
Siobhan 25-Jan-20 07:38 PM
Nar needed a moment of looking around before it dawned on her that the shouting was coming from somewhere down close to her knees. Her blissy smile stretched into a delighted one, and she squatted down immediately to at least be near Pixie's height. A thick tail, generally, helps with static balance, and hers almost hit the new arrival behind her when she changed positions. "Oh! You're just adorable. And so angry! I love it!" She pressed her hands to her cheeks. Her generally golden eyes had black streaks around the edges that made them look smudged. "Don't you hate how ea—"
Why would jasmine be strange to you?
Aha! A new voice. Nar tilted her head back, but she still wasn't low enough that Zechs had leaned over her, and she tried shuffling sideways enough to see both of them at once. In the limited space of the hallway, that left her leaning against a wall. She smiled when she noticed the horns, and much less cryptically than usual. Aside from the sharp teeth, there was no threat in it at all! "She might mean the other parts, cousin. Which is it, angry girl? The flowery smell, the sweet resinous one, or the one like the dark earth in a forest?" (edited)
Ippo 26-Jan-20 04:14 PM
Pixie turns to bring her finger about at Zechs. "I'm asking the questions here! Don't try to change the subject!" Back to Nar, who brought herself closer to Pixie's level, but further accusations didn't come just yet. Her face gets even redder until her puffed cheeks resemble a pair of pomegranates. Steam practically shoots from her pointed ears. "Dontchu patronize me, bish! I ain't adorable! Imma slap your fat cow udders off you if you keep that up!" Pixie might've made good on the promise had Nar remained where she was, but instead shot narrowed, angry eyes at the two horned people with her. She folds her arms. "You know what? No! I'm not telling you what part is weird--but I will demand you tell me how the fuck I get out of here! I keep getting lost!"
LordHavelock 28-Jan-20 12:57 PM
'Cousin?' Zeks wondered, almost aloud as the increasing strangeness of the situation began to throw him out of his comfortable element. This was more like navigating a tense exchange in a cover identity than what he was expecting of discourse between his colleagues in a professional mercenary company. Particularly the biting insults by the smallfolk delivered somewhere in the direction of the imposing figure towering above them both. If he'd been impersonating a more honorable figure, the 'udders' comment might have prompted some misguided defense of her honor. "Apologies, but you are the Asmodean? Yes?" Zeks said as he made good on his lithe form and agility to duck past first Nar and then Pixie, deft footwork carrying him to the other side of the hall so that the pink-haired halfling was now surrounded. To the increasingly incensed Pixie, he made sure to give plenty of space after passing within only hairsbreadth of their nose a moment before. "Surely if you keep going up you can't become so lost . . ." He murmured, doing his best to avoid showing his chagrin.
Siobhan 29-Jan-20 07:07 PM
"Mmmmmyyyes, The Asmodean." The woman was large enough she even giggled in a contralto. She adjusted the lay of her carmine robes, across her shoulders, in a way that wouldn't matter once she stood up again. "Minister-at-large Nar al Jahim." She was silent and smiling almost long enough for someone to interject before remembering to add the "Esquire!" Then she turned her attention back to Pixie, looking a very shallow kind of sad. "I wish it were as simple as he says. But there are some places you can go up six flights from the first deck down, still inside the ship. I haven't had anyone to help test where exactly those windows are, and I'm not sure I want to know. It is so very wrong in here."
Ippo 29-Jan-20 11:41 PM
"Wait a sec..." Pixie looks up and begins counting out her tiny fingers one by one, mouthing each number. "So... First deck down... Wait, that's bullshit! How can there be six flights of stairs on this thing? And what windows? I haven't seen any!" says the girl who only stands three feet high, not counting her hair. Frustrated, but steamed out, Pixie crosses her arms and slumps down on the floor. "This some bullshit."
LordHavelock 30-Jan-20 09:26 PM
Waiting expectantly for the minister's final declaration, and sparing a brief glance downwards as Pixie collapses into an irate but diminished heap on the floorboards between them, the apparent tiefling only purses his lips by way of consideration, before his reply. "I am Zeks." "The vessel has been straightforward with me thus far, though perhaps only because it is the approach I've taken to navigating it. I'm unsure how much is meant as a gag upon you Pixie, and how much as someone's idea of a security measure, as little sense as it would seem to make. Raises the possibility of stumbling upon a raiding party lost themselves for an indeterminate amount of time . . . ." Glancing over his shoulder, there is absolutely no indication he is joking. "Perhaps though, if you were explicit about where you are intending to be? I was on my way back to my own quarters, but I've scarcely made a home of them yet. Mistress Nar, my own mentor spoke highly, but vaguely of you, Confessor Venliss? Happens that the Church played a significant role in my upbringing, and he hinted that the same was true of your own."
Siobhan 30-Jan-20 11:47 PM
"It is a vessel with a history of combat with pirates," said Nar with a glance up at Zeks. The look in her eyes like she was holding a terribly amusing secret never quite left, nor did the lazy smile. It didn't really line up with her reputation for acumen and insight. "What's your name, angry girl? I don't know how you got here, but you're just in time to lift your spirits. Come inside with me." She waved a hand vaguely back the way she, and incidentally Zeks, had come. The smoke had mostly stopped seeping out, but it was still easy to tell which room it had been seeping from. She stood and gave Zeks a wink. "You too. We can talk about childhoods once you loosen up a bit."
Ippo 01-Feb-20 07:31 PM
Pixie by then has stuck a pinky in her ear to scratch around for something. "People call me Pixie, and fuggin' I just wanted to go to my room." But at Nar's suggestion, she pauses to squint at her. "Waaait, are you just trying to lure me into your room for sex stuff?"
Siobhan 01-Feb-20 09:08 PM
"Only if you ask politely," responded Nar without missing a beat. She rose to her feet, then. The robes were the right color, but they were hardly standard cut. Standard cut wouldn't have gripped her hips like that, and these were tailored snug. But a black pentacle was visible high on the back whenever her hair bounced out of the way, and she hadn't been smote for blasphemy yet. She turned and gestured for the others to follow, and immediately began walking the short distance back. "And you'll have to make amends for some of your comments before I even consider it. Your tongue gets away from you when you're frustrated." The smile crossing the she-devil's lips could easily be heard on her voice, but she didn't look back to reveal it, not even to check whether they had followed. She didn't look back until she had the door open again and was gesturing inside with a look of arch scrutiny.
Ippo 02-Feb-20 01:03 AM
Pixie hums as she considers this, pouting and narrowing her eyes the longer she did so, and said, "I ain't gonna ask--but I will say whatever the heck I want, Miss Udders, and you can't stop me!" Yet Pixie follows after Nar--why, she doesn't know. "I better not get raped in here, bitch. I know what you church types are like."
LordHavelock 03-Feb-20 11:45 PM
"Hardly a charitable view of the Church, or your shipmates. What? Do you suppose Asmodeans keep demons on hand for the deflowering of lost maidens at all times?" Zechs uttered dryly, as he followed pointedly remaining out of immediate reach of Pixie, but not so far away as to be completely standoffish. The invitation to Nar's chambers was not one he was about to refuse, but his expectations were somewhat skewed as she hardly seemed interested in matters of faith, even as a pleasantry. It was impossible to ignore the tempestuous flirtation she wreathed herself with, but neither did he take such a thing seriously in the slightest. "Loosen up . . . certainly. I suppose this is a good start." And then as if tensing momentarily, the relaxation written across his features and in his mien resolved itself into his natural appearance. Melting away like silvery shadow, the matching appearance of a tiefling became the even more willowy figure of the gray skin and lilac hair, far more subdued in tone than Pixie's pink locks.
Siobhan 04-Feb-20 12:42 AM
"Oh, not a cousin at all, then. That's funny, usually the disguise runs the other way. You are still my Guest." Her scrutiny admitted some amusement, but her eyes kept something in reserve yet. She followed them inside, the tip of her long tail just barely clearing the door as she shut it.
Avrae BOT 01-Apr-20 07:11 PM

Az (Cheer/Margot/Lott) 26-Apr-20 05:29 PM

Asked Garg in between of gulps of alcohol directly from the bottle. Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 04-Jun-20 12:56 AM
The color drained from Hal’s face for a moment, before her pale cheeks took on a slightly rosy tint. The girl had never been in love. Nor had anyone been in love with her. The aunt who’d pretended to love her like a daughter. All of it. Her choices. Her desperate need for acceptance. The girl just couldn’t let that go. How could one be stronger if they just... gave up? No. No, she couldn’t believe it. She wouldn’t! Her bright blue eyes started to sting just then, a wave of hopelessness and sadness swirling about her small body. “Sad...” Hal whispered, her own heart hurting. Was this the world trying to tell her all hope was lost? That she could never be worthy of the simplest things? Keth would be angered if she’d given into such dark thoughts. Then again, Keth could be lost to the Baron thanks to her choice of leaving him behind... But it had been the only choice. Or, had it? “I... As her mind swam with despair, she just latched onto the unconditional love that her brother always offered, as he’d desperately tried pulling her out of the Baron’s stupor. He’d thought her worth it. And that had to be enough to keep the hope alive. After all, it was all that she had. (edited)

Mors | Garg | Bof 05-Jun-20 12:10 AM
Garg laughed after hearing Pen's words. "Hinder me you say?... Do you even know about sharkins, how their hearts work? We constantly battle against the adrenaline in our veins, only a thin line separate us from becoi mindless beasts... And a mindless beasts is easily killed." He explained, his growly voice dripping with venom. "We mate for life. Once betrayed our heart breaks and we die. That's why we are so rare. Fucking gods didn't think that people were selfish assholes... The world was still to new when we were created." He started to pace in front of the couple, hands crossed over his chest bwhile he rambled. "But that's not me anymore... Now I am in control. All sharkin, no weakness. No more hindered by love." Then he stopped and his red eyes found Hal's. "Let this be a lesson for you shadow girl. You seek forgiveness? For what? Own your shit. You screwed with some idiots... So be it. I kept enjoying my life." "I fought, I lost, I fucked and fell in love. I was abandoned and left to die... He finished, looking straight at pen and with his arms open wide and a wide, evil grin adorning his shark face.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 05-Jun-20 12:28 AM
The more Hal heard, the more her own heart hurt. She had expected a dark and tragic tale, but she hadn’t realized just how deep that darkness would go... no wonder this shark was the way he was. It seemed... so unfair. Hal had remained still, quiet, just listening as Garg spoke. But when his gaze fell upon her, it was like suddenly a weight was thrust upon her. She felt small. Alone. Judged. All her fears for all her past choices bombarding her right then and there. Of course, once her brother had opened her eyes and shown her the way, she’d done the best that she could. It just hurt that it had never been enough. And now. Now she worried she’d forever be alone. Unwanted. Unloved. A shameful being who let life dictate her path, rather than seizing the moment and controlling her own destiny. For a few brief moments, Hal struggled to breathe. Face turning red, she finally returned the shark’s gaze. She felt so badly for him. To have suffered like that and now... now he endured this existence he’d made for himself. Though he touted his joy, she could feel the anger rolling off him in waves. A powerful and frightening anger she never knew could exist. Was there a way to help him? She bet he wouldn’t want it. Or, that’s what he’d say at least. Somehow she knew this. “Where... where’s your heart then?” Hal finally asked, placing herself between the shark and the golden eyed man, while mustering up all her courage to inquire about such a personal thing. But something inside her told she had to help the captain... or at least give it her best and try. Because if she didn’t, the girl was certain no one else would. (edited)

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 07-Jun-20 09:20 PM
Hal just looked down at the ground, her face burning. She bit down on her inner cheek and then cleared her throat. “Yes. An engine. So I’m heading there. If any of you want to follow you’re welcome, as I’m not sure what I’ll find. But...” her voice trailed slightly. “But at least I can answer just one more of the questions that seem to surround this...” The girl waved her hands around slightly. “Place.” As Hal took a step forward down the corridor, she turned her head to see if anyone would bother following or not. If not, it wouldn’t be the first time she’d been left alone to her own devices and it probably wouldn’t be the last time either. Still, she wasn’t trying to be secretive. At least not about this. Not yet. There wasn’t really any reason to be, so far as she could tell. Her blue eyes watched the others—the golden man, the shark, the demon. It was hard to tell what any of them were thinking. Or if they even had an agenda at all. Just then, she saw the flashes of lightning. She’d seen as much before and knew it had the capacity to kill. It had brought those knights down, along with a fire guardian after all. Looking back at the ground, she turned again, making her way to the #engine-room and this now enigmatic steel heart.
Delielah/Abby 08-Jun-20 02:54 PM
The Succubus would be surprised by the shark man's antics, noticing the sparks of lightning and the fact that this thing before her was likely a warlock, and a drink one to boot, it would do her no favours, "I... Don't know who your boss is, nor do I care about this Draq fellow you speak of." Delielah that there was a certain weight in the air as Hal had left with the object, she could that being here is likely going to have her meet a blade, "Don't worry, I know when a lady shouldn't follow an opportunity..." She would then wave goodbye to Pendragon before slipping back to her room to avoid a confrontation.

Garg watched Delielah go and raised an eyebrow. He wondered why most of the people around this place were so skittish. It was a damned ship, and even though these weren't exactly sailors they should have some backbone. Fuck it... He finally thought before turning around, "More rum for me then... He growled but then noticed the open door and decided to go there, after all he didn't have anything better to do right now. Lucky for him, it was the right door so he went into the #engine-room

Avrae BOT 10-Jun-20 03:32 AM
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Jun-20 06:10 PM
Sela has just finished pouring over the myriad of shelves in the library. She hadn’t wanted to stay there long... not after those rumors had managed to find her. Word was out that others on board the ship had decided to be indecent, knowing others were actually present and trying to do some research. Word was also out that one of those unfortunate souls had been none other than the Grand General she and Bofwant had escorted not all that long ago. And, to be honest, she wasn’t certain she wanted to accidentally bump into that man either. A shiver ran along Sela’s spine, as she recalled that strange arm. And that demonic bird he seemed to have quite a rapport with. Clutching her books to her chest—books on oni lore and... the darker arts—she hoped to make it back to Bofwant’s room without having to worry about others. Or... shenanigans. At least then she could do her research in peace. In quiet. Without worry of being judged or worse.
( @Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) )
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 10-Jun-20 06:18 PM
Sela's fears seemed to come true. The narrow hallways were soon graced with the Grand General himself, seemingly cleaned up since the last time they met. His outfit did seem clean... but still as dark and intimidating as before. His boots clack as he strolls through, that damned bird perched on his shoulder. And as they get closer... he holds a hand up. "Selaphiel. A word, if you will?"
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Jun-20 06:45 PM
Immediately the air seemed to still, Sela suddenly finding it almost impossible to breathe. Desperate to catch her breath, she just remained rooted to the spot, her knuckles going white, while she clung to those books in her arms. “I... I...” she stammered, somehow, against her own will, looking up at the man. Her golden eyes found his and that fear turned into a bitter chill coursing through her veins. She then noticed that bird on his shoulders, the one who whispered demonic words upon the air. Without realizing what she was doing, the girl’s red head began nodding. Knowing she couldn’t take the gesture back, she felt a piece of herself whither and grow cold inside. “I... I suppose,” she then answered softly, wincing all the while.
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 10-Jun-20 06:55 PM
All those signs she gave, she might have thought they were minor... but Jericho picks them up effortlessly. He slowly turns to face her, making sure to maintain constant eye contact, his piercing red eyes fixated on her. "Back along my rescue, Eleanor and I have noticed something... off about you. Your staring, your pauses, your intense fear. It is highly... unnatural. It has me worried."
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Jun-20 07:04 PM
Worried? Why would this man she barely knew be worried about her? Sela felt a strange knot form in her tummy, the bile slowly rising up. “Worried?” she merely regurgitated her thoughts. Perhaps it was because she could’ve cost him his life. Her past, her baggage... her own set of demons. Again, she eyed the bird. But it was difficult to look away, Jericho’s eyes almost forcing her to meet his gaze without having to say the words. “You needn’t worry about me,” she blurted. “I... I’m fine. I... I didn’t cause trouble during the escort mission.”
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 10-Jun-20 07:51 PM
"You did not cause trouble... that time. I do not wish there to be further problems due to your... issues. I wish to know why you freeze, and why being around me causes issues. It is not me being nosy, I am simply gathering information." He steps slightly closer, making his authority known. Eleanor caws softly, flaring her wings up.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Jun-20 08:05 PM
Sela noticeably trembled, her grip growing that much tighter on her books. “I...” she stammered, swallowing hard, as she tried her best to compose herself. Again, her eyes glimpsed that bird, her velvet black wings ruffling before her golden eyes. Just then, she was struck by flashbacks. Memories of a time she longed to forget stabbing at her skull. “I... I try not to,” Sela went on, her color slowly draining. “And I don’t mean to offend, but...” Her voice trailed, mouth going dry. “I sense a strange...” She winced, worried she’d come off tactless and disrespectful. “Well, darkness. Not something I’ve sensed since...” The girl gasped then, mortified that she’d divulged far too much. Soon everyone would know her brush with evil, that terrible kiss sealing her parents’ ultimate fate. Not that she missed them... not that she hadn’t felt relief at their passing. But what did that make her? The very thought sickened her, made her fear just what her love might come to see and think about her as a result. Just then, Sela felt her eyes begin to sting. She loosened her grip on her books, the one quite visible if Jericho should look—Dark Circles: Harnessing A Secret Power. Reaching up, she wiped at her eyes, frustrated with herself and longing to hide.
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 10-Jun-20 08:13 PM
"Darkness... you sense darkness within me? An astute observation." He pauses with her miniature episode, eventually gazing upon the dropped book. Ever so slowly, he bends to pick up the book, gently wipe off anything that got on it, then carefully inspects it. "Interesting... this Darkness makes you physically weak, yet you wish to read on it?"
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Jun-20 08:47 PM
Biting down on her lower lip, Sela lowered her head. This man was... aware? Choosing that sickly shroud to envelop him whole? The very notion made her tummy churn, an unsettling feeling washing over her right then. “Well,” she began, her eyes then moving to her book that he now held. “It... it’s not what you think.” Her cheeks turned pink despite her blanched pallor. “It... it’s my brother...” It wasn’t wholly a lie, but it was definitely an excuse to shift the focus off of her. He didn’t need to know of her past, of the terrible things her parents did... and promised. “He’s been cursed, you see. By... by some woman.” Her tone showed her nervousness, her body language clearly indicating her anxiety and desire to get her book back.
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 10-Jun-20 08:57 PM
"Cursed? That is... incredibly interesting to hear. What nature of curse, if I can inquire? Fiendish in nature? Perhaps Fey?"
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Jun-20 09:10 PM
Why would such a thing be interesting? What’s more to someone who didn’t know her, Barachiel... her family. Acid seemed to run through her veins, as she allowed her thoughts to drift to her parents. The horrible things they’d done and promised. “I... I don’t know, sir,” Sela answered, her voice sounding somewhat strangled. In truth, she did not. But her heart knew the cold truth. As Barachiel’s twin, she could feel that demonic pulse emanating from whatever it was that had set its eye upon him. That eye now upon her as well. “He transforms into an oni. Every... every new moon, he is no longer himself. I... I must help him. I couldn’t save him that night, though I’d tried. Now... now everything is a mess and it’s all my fault.” Her fingers went to her face then, tracing that scar that reminded her of her own weakness. The one marring the flesh of her otherwise pretty face.
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 10-Jun-20 09:15 PM
"All your fault...and you think this book of Darkness can assist you? A book of harnessing twisted powers? You do not seem the type to engage in this type of activity. I do not even think you have the stomach. Sela, I feel as if there is something you are not telling me...that is unwise. Being honest to me is the greatest thing you can ever do to me, you know. The powers I hold could assist you, even if not directly." His gaze and his words pierce just right. He remains calm, collected, and keeps himself in charge. He doesn't bring out his fiendish arm...yet.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Jun-20 09:23 PM
In that moment, Sela felt fear grip at her heart, squeezing tightly, while her heart began to pound. A cold sweat beaded along her brow, the girl feeling dizzy, like she might faint. “I... I’m not meaning to offend,” she explained, hoping it would be enough. She didn’t want trouble, and she worried that everyone would turn their back on her should they learn the whole truth of her past. Eyes watering, her lips could still feel that horrible kiss. The one her parents had forced upon her and for what? She didn’t understand their politics or affiliations. But it had been worth enough for them to promise her to the hells, to separate her from her twin. “My... my parents...” The girl began to cry then, unable to hold the tears back any longer. “I don’t understand what they’ve done...” Her knees wobbled then, the girl unsteady, as the world threatened to collapse upon her. “I want to... I need to. That book will help me.”
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 10-Jun-20 09:28 PM
The Grand General tried his best to understand, but her bawling didn't help any. But if there is something that Jericho understood at all, it was personal darkness. Pain. Suffering. Suffering he felt, or inflicted, he could feel it. The Denoxian before her simply shook his head, keeping his cool. "Your parents has done something you do not understand... you feel darkness within you because of it. I can almost see it, as clear as day. This book I hold has the answers, hm? Yet I look at you now, barely able to stand, and I do not believe you have the strength to even hold this thing. Sela... you must not let this darkness consume you so."
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 10-Jun-20 09:50 PM
Sela wiped at her eyes, neck craning so she could look up at the Grand General. She thought back to those moments of clarity. The ones she’d had, while searching for her brother. Time and again, she had failed. Faced death. Faced dark and haunting dreams. Her luck had changed when she’d gotten aid through the guild. With their help, she’d found her brother, only... She hadn’t expected to find him under a curse, a deep and dark curse that seemed to somehow seep its way into those dark promises her parents had kept. Now that she’d found her twin, however, those moments were gone. She was back to the mental mess she’d become, that girl her brother had done his utmost to protect. “Nothing is consuming me,” Sela defended herself. She couldn’t allow herself to believe that darkness her parents had conjured and called was now somehow coursing through her veins, seeking into her blood, her body. “I’ll be all right.” The moment she said the words, she winced, somehow knowing this man would see through the lie. A lie she so wished with all her soul was actually true. “It was long ago. I’m sure they no longer have interest.” But did they? Sela honestly had no idea. She hadn’t called to those demons. Her parents had. Whether or not those beasts would ever bother her again was something she didn’t know. But she could feel their influence whenever this man was near. Or his bird. Was he somehow demonic? Did he know more than he let on? “D-demon’s can lose interest... right?” Sela asked, her tone pleading for Jericho to ease her fears. Even if it had to be a lie.
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 10-Jun-20 10:02 PM
"Darkness is a...general term, dear Sela. It could mean a devil's influence, all the way to personal issues. In a way, there is darkness within us all...but it is how we identify and deal with it. You might not be all right. And Demons can lose interest...but only if their investments cannot turn a profit. If something has its eyes on you? It might never be looking away." He's...blunt. But he seems serious, even now. Eventually, he holds the books with two hands...having to manifest that glowing red arm, covered in feathers, nails sharpened like talons...
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Jun-20 05:18 AM
The moment Sela sees that arm, she feels a sharp pain deep within her mind. Immediately, she looks away, tummy hurting, as her world begins to spin. “Please, sir,” she then begged. It was obvious that the sight of whatever demonic magic had taken his arm was causing her some sort of discomfort. “I don’t wish to offend or anger, b-but...” Looking up into the Grand General’s face, her eyes implored that he somehow understand. As her fear continued to grow, Sela could feel that her knees were ready to give out, her body suddenly too difficult to hold upright. She leaned against the wall then, breaths coming short and hard. “Please...” she then begged, her words a breathy whisper. “Th-they never stop watching.” It was an admission she did not wish to divulge, but somehow her mouth was betraying her. “I don’t know how to make them stop.”
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 11-Jun-20 09:41 PM
"If you wish to make them stop watching...you force them to stop. You force them to watch others for you, as I have done. Sela, I can tell you are in trouble. You have darkness within you that might even eclipse my own...it is obvious to me that you have suffered. I have suffered too, but I cannot and will not compare. All I can offer is assistance." As a show of good will, he offers his hand to help stabilize her...his fiendish hand. It thrums gently with pure energy, a few feathers falling to the floor and disintegrating. His eyes never move away from her for even a moment, standing tall and proud. Yet, he attempts to show compassion, even if it is misplaced.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Jun-20 09:49 PM
Just as Sela thought she might fall, she was suddenly caught. A strong arm holding her up, keeping her upright. Her golden eyes slid to where Jericho’s demonic arm stretched out towards her, his grip oddly gentle considering what she saw. For a moment, the girl thought she couldn’t breathe. But her mind suddenly stilled, her eyes moving from the arm to the Grand General’s eyes. “Assistance?” she the reiterated, somehow finding the wherewithal to state the question out loud. “You... you’d help me?” For a fleeting moment, hope filled the red head’s heart. To be free of these waking nightmares, terrors so dark and deep, she fears it might harm those she loves most. “Please...” she went on, desperation etched across her face. “What do I need to do?”
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 11-Jun-20 09:58 PM
"That...depends. The darkness we sense within you is severe. When I suffered as you did, I felt...useless. I felt weak. I only stand strong today because I turned the darkness within me into pure power. My pain and weakness had to become something else...it had to turn into my strength. This fiend that stirs within me allows me to more directly harness my inner darkness, and lash it out. Sela, to be honest...you will never be free of the darkness. But that is not a curse. It is a blessing in disguise, a way to grow stronger ever stronger. The first step? Find a conduit. Find a way to turn this darkness into something...tangible." Crackling lightning suddenly flares between his fingertips, then calms. His eyes almost seem to flare...then cease. The Grand General, for a split second, gives a soft smile, and almost a chuckle.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Jun-20 10:06 PM
In that moment, Sela could hear the whispers of voices she’d managed to barley muffle since those days her parents had used her. Their purpose was still uncertain, but what they’d conjured and called... it would never be forgotten. And now, more than ever, she needed to find her strength. For once she had to be the protector for her twin, not the other way around. But how could she when she was a simpering mess? No. Something needed to be done. She just needed to be shown the way. Gasping softly, Sela felt the strange charge of magic swirling about the Grand General, just barely touching her soul and mind. Yes, she was afraid. Terrified! But she couldn’t continue in this way. Not if she was to aid her brother, to be there for Bofwant, the guild. “I...” Sela stammered, unsure but needing to choose a path in which to walk. “How do I do that?” she finally asked. “They are watching. I feel their eyes, their breath. It used to be just in dreams, but now it’s even while I’m awake...” she spilled, her chest tightening, as those demonic whispers nudged her ever onward.
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 11-Jun-20 10:44 PM
"They can no longer watch. You must now find the authority to say you are in charge of your darkness! Those creatures are now yours. For me... I used a pact to seal that power."
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 11-Jun-20 10:55 PM
“A pact?” Sela asked, the word sounding almost foreign as she spoke it. Yet, the girl seemed intimately familiar with what it had meant. Her parents. Her parents had tried to make such a deal. Only, in the end they’d failed. Perhaps it was because their souls and hearts were black as pitch. Evil through and through. Maybe, with her own good intentions... “I’ll do it...” she blurted, not thinking it through. The girl’s innocence clouding her mind and her judgment. “I’m tired of always being afraid, being a burden.” Her eyes watered again, her thoughts drifting to both her twin and to Bofwant. “I need to take back the life that had been stolen and destroyed. Please...” she looked up at Jericho imploringly. “How do I make this pact?”
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 12-Jun-20 02:02 AM
"You will never be a burden again. But this pact... I must say first. Never, EVER believe you have no power in your pact. Your patron needs you, as much as you need it. A patron's influence is related to its pacts... and broken pacts weaken them. You must face your patron as if they are equal, even if you are weaker to them. Do you understand? Can you handle it?"
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 12-Jun-20 07:54 AM
Sela nodded, trying her best to understand. Somehow in her heart, she knew it was those demons that had killed her parents. For a long time, she’d lied to herself that it had been the beast who’d taken her brother. But, as she quieted her mind and allowed herself to remember... she knew that was just happenstance. Her parents dark work had just made it easier for the thing to come and do what it had wanted. A dark beacon almost calling it to their home. Oh, what a mess her parents had caused. She wondered if she might ever learn what caused them to go to such lengths. To be that desperate... Briefly, Sela thought on all those times she’d heard her parents arguing. Barachiel has always been there to give her comfort, or to even try and stop their parents from doing something rash. But slowly, she saw whatever loved had once existed between the pair dissolve like mists on the wind. Her father misplaced his love and affection, using her to fill that void. She could still feel how his hands touched her, moved over her in ways a father’s hands never should. She remembered how much those moments had pleased the man, but angered her mother. A mother not upset that her daughter was becoming frightened of her father, but because she was something more. Something desired. Something she could never be any longer. Sela flinched then, pushing away those horrific thoughts from her past and looked up at Jericho, eyes wide and pleading. “I understand, General,” she finally managed to say. “I have endured such things that... I have to believe I’m strong to have survived.” Her one hand gently gripped the cuff of his sleeve. “I will face my fear. And conquer it. I... I must be the one left standing tall.” Her twin, her love... they both needed her. For them, she would make herself something strong and beautiful and useful.
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 13-Jun-20 02:28 PM
If Sels was still on the floor, Jericho slowly assisted in bringing her on her feet. Once finished, his fiendish arm diminished as he retreated the stump into his coat, then slowly nods. "I admire your tenacity. The only way to survive is overcome your weakness, use this darkness to your advantage... The first step is calling upon a patron. The only issue is deciding who to call upon."
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 13-Jun-20 07:59 PM
Sela made no move to resist Jericho’s assistance, allowing him to easily help her back up, so that she stood before him. The girl kept her eyes on his, trying to maintain her focus, while her mind reeled with possibilities. If she could truly harness this darkness, learn to wield it somehow... she’d be an asset to both her brother and her love. Barachiel’s curse would easily be lifted; she had no doubt. And Bofwant... she’d be far more useful to him strong than as she was. Able to aid in battle, to hold focus when her wits were needed. She could help him find his own missing brother. “Th-thank you, sir,” Sela finally managed to answer. “How do I decide such things?” She looked up at the Grand General with wide and curious eyes, hoping he knew the answer. A part of her wondered if she should call the ones who’d made her parents demise a reality. In a way, she owed them thanks. Though they were also the ones responsible for her nightmares—both asleep and awake. But how to even find them? She wasn’t sure. Nor did she know if it was wise. One word from the General, however, and she just might have her answer.
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 13-Jun-20 11:20 PM
"I cannot make the decision for you, and my patron is well taken. However... I will say that if there are any fiends that even have a slightest clue who you are, they are easier to invoke. If you know any, they are your best bet. Otherwise, I can scour what fiends my patron knows of."
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 14-Jun-20 01:58 AM
In that moment, Sela had her answer. She clutched Jericho’s arm, desperate for reassurance. “I know who, though I do not know their name,” she stated. “He... he knows me well,” she went on, admitting the intimacy already present between herself and her chosen patron. Her parents had seen to that years ago. This demon never far off as a result. A part of her always wondered if the bond she knew already existed was why her parents were slaughtered. If only it had prevented the loss she’d endured when Barachiel was taken away. But no matter. She’d risen to that challenge, facing her fears and finding her lost twin. “A... a demon of shadow,” she continued, remembering that terrifying kiss that had sealed her fate long ago. She hadn’t understood it then, but now... Suddenly, she heard that familiar whisper, felt the growing smile of one watching her. Accepting her, embracing her. He was there. Listening with great approval, urging her to give in to the calling. “He knew my parents. I... I choose him. Lord of Mist and Shadow, the Herald of Darkness.”
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 14-Jun-20 06:18 PM
"The Lord of Mist and Shadow, Herald of Darkness..." His fiendish arm reignites to life once again, the faint glow bathing them in a deep, dark red. He thinks for a moment, then nods. "My patron knows of him, this should be easy. Though my patron does speak of him in a rather... disdained tone. He thinks him to be a carefree fool. They have done business dealings in the past, but nothing major. If you choose him, you must be aware that even with his tempting tone, you are both equals, through and through."
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 14-Jun-20 07:39 PM
Sela felt the strange power hum off of Jericho’s arm, her grip on him tightening with anticipation. Giving the Grand General a nod, she licked at her suddenly dry lips, mind swirling with possibility for the very first time. “I... I’ll remember,” she repeated. A part of her worried that her choice was not acceptable, but it was the only one she knew and... she could already feel his smile in the back of her mind, his whispers growing stronger. Urging her on. “And hopefully they can learn to get on well. I... I think I’d like that,” she admitted, blushing a little. For the first time, someone understood the darkness the curdled deep in her veins. To have a sort of mentor was more than enticing. Though, after everything, she suddenly worried Bofwant might not approve. But then again... this was him, for Barachiel. For their future. She needed to be at her best for them all. And this was one way she could do her part. “So how do I call him?”
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 15-Jun-20 06:26 PM
"Calling him is a different story. One would think of inhumane rituals or sacrifices...but with your willingness and closeness to this creature, it should be simple. I will be there to assist you of course, and he may be curious as to why he senses the power of the Raven Father. My arm could serve as a beacon of sorts, if done well. However, we need a private area. Do you have any in mind?"
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 15-Jun-20 06:39 PM
The idea of calling him forth, seizing control of her fears and uncertainty. It was so very enticing, just what she needed to stop the nightmares, the pain. To never burden Bofwant or Barachiel again. The girl looked up at Jericho and nodded. “Perhaps my room would suffice?” she suggested, already feeling that strange warmth she recalled from all those years ago. He was watching. Waiting. But Sela knew she needed to have the upper hand. And this was why the Grand General needed to be by her side, as she took these very first step to face the darkness threatening to devour her completely. “I hardly use it,” she went on. “Most of my things have been moved to Bofwant’s room.” Her cheeks darkened into a dusky pink, golden eyes lowering to the floor. “Will that work? It... it’s just up the hall.”
Sethy (Faith,Jericho,Butcherer) 15-Jun-20 06:49 PM
"Of course. Please, lead the way." He makes a motion for her to move on, adjusting his cloak to appear refined again, preparing for what is to come.
