As though she were under the effects of a spell, Margot strided down the halls to her room to put her things away. Then, after coming out, she went further down the hall to knock on a door. This had to be the one Ferisso was behind. In her head, she thank Warden for the support.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 26-Aug-20 10:21 PM
Ferisso's door opens, and the tiefling blinks as he sees the mage from their abandoned mission on the other side. As recognition sets in, his expression quirks up into a smile. She'd been fun to be around, even if things had gone poorly in the end. "Oh, hey, Margot. What brings you 'round to my door?"
Az (Cheer/Margot/Lott) 26-Aug-20 10:27 PM
“I want to date you.” Margot said, very simply. Her hands were behind her back, her body leaning forward slightly to make her look cuter. Was it going to succeed? This was merely something she read in fiction once.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 26-Aug-20 10:32 PM
"Huh... Must've made a better first impression than I thought, then." He chuckles to himself as he folds his arms and laxly leans against his room's doorframe, but nods amicably after a moment's contemplation. "Sure, might as well try it, see how we mesh. I imagine you had some sort of plan for that, then?"
Az (Cheer/Margot/Lott) 26-Aug-20 10:39 PM
“I just thought we could get something to eat somewhere.” Margot answered. “Or just hang out and talk. That’s as far as I planned, aside from one thing that I don’t think we’ll do on this first date.”
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 26-Aug-20 10:49 PM
"Ah, classy. To the lounge, then? Seems as good a place to spend some time as any, if you just wanted to hang around and get a meal." He stands back to full height from leaning, ready to follow the spellcaster.
Az (Cheer/Margot/Lott) 26-Aug-20 11:03 PM
“Yes, that’s good enough.” Margot said, stepping out of the door’s way. “You first.”
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 26-Aug-20 11:04 PM
He closes the door behind him as he steps out of his room, and then offers his arm to the woman. "Please, what sort of gentleman would I be if I let you trail behind me, ah?"
Az (Cheer/Margot/Lott) 27-Aug-20 10:22 PM
“Oh, right.” Margot sheepishly said, taking her hand into the Tiefling’s arm.
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 27-Aug-20 10:36 PM
And so, linked arm-in-arm, he'll lead the way over to the #lounge.
Avrae BOT 27-Aug-20 10:36 PM
Halanaestra Ellorenthi d’Phiarlan BOT 30-Aug-20 09:42 PM
Garg was sleeping fitfully, though Hal was sure to check his fin before she left. The girl placed a gentle kiss on the side of his head and whispered, “I’ll be back, Captain. Promised Thrin I’d meet them in the library. I’m uncertain of what they want, but they seemed to feel a strong need to speak with me.” Again, she kissed the shark and then wrote her words down on a stray piece of parchment on the night table. “I’m writing everything down here in case you wake up or forget what I’m telling you. We will rewrap your fin once I return.” At that, Hal quietly padded out of the room and closed the door behind her. She was fairly certain Garg would sleep through until her return, but she felt the need to not take any chances. Once out in the halls, the red head began heading towards the library. On the way, she saw Thrin storming towards her, their face twisted into some sort of angry scowl. She arched a brow and just stood there, not wanting to deal with them if all they were going to be was angry. Especially for no reason at all.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 30-Aug-20 09:42 PM
( @Reese (Thrin✨Tomara✨Parker) )
Reese (Thrin✨Tomara✨Parker) 30-Aug-20 10:08 PM
Thrin stomps through the halls, and their eyes light furiously as they see the flame-haired elf in front of them, completely calm. "I've been waiting all fucking day for you, what the fuck Hal!" They hiss quietly, not wanting to attract the attention of any other guildmates. "Believe it or not this is actually important to me, and I need to make sure anyone involved is actually fucking trustworthy!"
Halanaestra Ellorenthi d’Phiarlan BOT 30-Aug-20 10:19 PM
Hal merely frowned, sighing softly as Thrin just made all these assumptions without any thought to what might have been going on in her own personal life. “Well, I hadn’t meant to make you wait. But the Captain injured himself and needed medical attention and care.” She paused a moment, crossing her arms about her middle and looking away. “Believe it or not, sometimes certain things need to take precedence. Though I know this is a concept you seem to have troubles understanding.” Truly, she was dumbfounded. This person seemed to not ever think it mattered to try and empathize, to take into consideration what another besides themselves might be dealing with. It reminded her of the Baron and her selfish motives. Actions and plans that utterly destroyed her family, her life. “But we are here now. Though I’d rather talk somewhere a bit less traveled. People are always coming and going in the corridors.”
Reese (Thrin✨Tomara✨Parker) 30-Aug-20 10:23 PM
Thrin's expression softens a bit. Then they're frustrated that they care. It's Garg of all people. What a shithead. But Hal seems to care about people an general... "Ngh... Goddamn you, being nice. Fine, I guess that makes sense." The changeling's ears flicker nervously as they look down the halls and think. They seem tense, but their guarded nature seems nervous, and offensive out of a perceived necessity. "....Top deck. There's an annoyingly friendly Goliath in the library who'd try to get involved."
Halanaestra Ellorenthi d’Phiarlan BOT 30-Aug-20 10:36 PM
Hal wondered just who this goliath Thrin was alluding to might be. There seemed to be a rather large number of the giants on board the Steel Hearts. And to think she’d never met one before coming on board! “That will be fine,” she concurred, and began making her way towards the stairs that led to the desired destination. While they made their way up, she couldn’t help but wonder just what was so pressing and urgent. They seemed agitated, much like they’d been back on the job when she’d more or less told them that she didn’t believe they had elven blood coursing in their veins. Though why that mattered so much, she didn’t understand. The girl could care less just what Thrin was or came from. It was their chosen actions of the moment that defined them, not anything else. Her only issue was that the lie could’ve cost them all their lives. Nothing more. (Exit to #the-top-deck )
Avrae BOT 12-Sep-20 05:23 PM
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 21-Sep-20 11:43 PM
Uthal was on his way to the medbay, having to take a shortcut through the main hall. It was here that someone bounced off him, looking down he saw it was the woman who was last seen with the Sharkin, Garg. "Excuse me, I didn't see you there." he would say, offering a hand to help her up.
Halanaestra Ellorenthi d’Phiarlan BOT 22-Sep-20 07:53 AM
Hal had run out of the med bay after Garg, fairly certain he’d go back to their room. While on the way, her thoughts a frenzy of “what ifs”, the girl hadn’t fully paid attention to where she was going and then accidentally bumped into a very large... goliath. She didn’t know Uthal very well, but remembered him from Iri’s wedding and as someone who’d participated in the sparring matches. “Oh... I...” Hal stammered, having fallen squarely on her backside before the giant. Face red, she took his offered hand and got up, craning her neck to look up at him. Seemed there were a lot of goliath on board the Steel Heart. “No, I’m sorry,” she went on. “I... I wasn’t paying attention and therefore didn’t see you.” The girl realized the ridiculousness of that statement given how much larger he was in comparison. Needless to say, it was still the truth, but that did nothing to help her hide her embarrassment.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 22-Sep-20 12:56 PM
Uthal didn't seem to mind her running into him; in fact, it was kind of fortuitous he had come across her. She looked like someone who could use what he had, or at the very least know what it was he had taken from the Nergaliid. He only knew her from seeing her by Garg's side and from witnessing her speaking with Irithriel, Mors' beloved, not too much else though. "I don't believe we've been properly introduced. I am Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi." he would say, giving her a slight bow of his head and placing a closed fist against his chest. If she looked though, she would see in his other massive hand a black, sickly-looking organ, seeming to ooze with malicious intent.
Halanaestra Ellorenthi d’Phiarlan BOT 23-Sep-20 10:31 PM
”Nice to meet you, Mr Katho-Olavi,” Hal stated, looking up into the Goliath’s face. “I’m Hal Ellorenthi,” she went on, giving a small curtsy, while introducing herself. As always, that decorum from the courts that had been ingrained in her way and manner came to the forefront. The red head then turned her head, blue eyes immediately noticing that oozing sac in Uthal’s hand. “I... I didn’t take you as the sort to consort with Nergaliids,” Hal added, giving the giant a half smile. Of course, she figured he’d probably been out hunting or something similar. Given the way he’d taken to sparring, it wasn’t a farfetched assumption at all. “Do be careful though,” Hal continued, pointing at the sac. “You hold a potent poison in your hands there. Did you know you could lace your weapons with it?” Her face lit up. It had been a while since she’d practiced her craft of poison making. It had been something she and Etrian had done together before the Schism. “Do you... do you happen to have any rats? Or any small rodent really...” Hal inquired. “If you do, I could try making you some bottles of poison. I just need something to test it on.” Her cheeks reddened then. Yes, when she heard herself, it sounded barbaric and grisly. But, practicality alleviated the awkwardness. After all, better to test a rat than a person.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 23-Sep-20 10:40 PM
Uthal nodded back at her, "A pleasure to meet you formally as well." He wouldn't have minded if she didn't curtsy or do any formal gesture; it wasn't like he was raised in a high family of noble order. No, he lived a simple life in the outlands, surviving and testing himself to the very best of his ability. He looked down at the poison sac, chuckling as she mentioned him consorting with Nergaliids. "Believe it or not, this was my first time encountering one. Nasty things they are; at the very least it shall not be bothering anyone else." he would say, remembering how he cut off its head. He still had its head in his room as a trophy, still very well preserved. "I was actually trying to find someone to explore applications of it; I do not know in the slightest how this poison works. But your words tell me you have experience with such things." And it was confirmed when she asked if he had any rodents; he had no clue what she was going on about, but he was able to at least deduce it was her means of making poison itself. "I do not...But I'm sure I can find one if I look hard enough...." he then said. But it was here that he had another idea. "I wonder....When the fiend bit Kor, it left a nasty-looking wound on him. I wonder, could this poison be used to make someone resistant? There were those among other Goliath clans and the Katho-Olavi who believed that if they got bit enough it would allow them to escape poison unscathed...Is there any truth to that?"
Halanaestra Ellorenthi d’Phiarlan BOT 23-Sep-20 10:56 PM
Hal’s expression turned thoughtful, her eyes going distant for a moment. The girl then nodded, red hair swishing about her porcelain pale face. “Well, if you ingest small doses of a particular poison over time... you can eventually gain a sort of resistance.” She smiled a bit. “It will certainly help slow it down,” she went on. “In some cases it might give you an advantage, while in others, you might suffer the effects far less.” Blue eyes now trained on the venom, Hal had to wonder just how this goliath had acquired his prize. “But yes, Mr Katho-Olavi. You’d be correct in that.” The girl took a step back then, her eyes moving to the ship’s floor. “Hrmm... If you catch a rat, I’ll help you try to make some.” She paused then, hand raising so she could tug on her lower lip. “Only problem... where to try making this? I’d offer my own room, but... G-Garg is there. The Captain is resting for the moment.”
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 23-Sep-20 11:07 PM
Uthal seemed contemplative as she explained that the stories he'd heard were true; such an advantage could be....very useful. He would be willing to be subject to it, if it meant getting an ability to at least resist being poisoned. And if he managed to get immunity? That would be even better!" "Well, I'm sure we can utilize my quarters if it is too much trouble. I have barely anything in there, so it should give you enough room to work. I can see about finding a rat while we walk as well." he would say, leaving the final choice to her. "I truly thank you for this, Hal...You'll have to tell me more about this poison though, and how one can become hardier against it." He'd never used much poison if any; poison tended to spoil the meat, especially if the wrong one was used. Plus, there was no better feeling among his fellow hunters in the Katho-Olavi about knowing they felled a great beast with nothing but their own skill and hands.
Halanaestra Ellorenthi d’Phiarlan BOT 24-Sep-20 09:57 PM
For a brief moment, Hal’s thoughts went to Garg. Her Captain had dashed out so quickly the moment Iri had gone into labor. Not once did he urge she follow him. Not once did he explain where he was going or why. Her heart lurched then, worry and fear coursing through her veins. She then took a steady breath and nodded, her eyes still connecting with those of Uthal’s. “Yes. All right,” she said. “We can go to your room and I’ll see what I can do.” As the strange pair made their way through the hall, Hal thought about what she’d try to make... and just what she’d say to Garg when she found him later on. “It will take about an hour to create the poison,” she then explained. “It just takes a bit of time to experiment and test. But hopefully I’ll manage something.” The girl gave him a smile and silently hoped she could truly deliver. After a few minutes, Hal noticed they were passing by a few different doors. “Which room is yours?” she asked Uthal, wondering which room was his.
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 24-Sep-20 10:00 PM
"Excellent." Uthal replied shortly, turning on his heel and leading the way back to his quarters. He turned and looked at her as she walked with him, his footsteps creating little tremors in the ship's flooring as he listened to her explaining the time it would take. "Yes, I imagine such a thing would require great care. But worry not, Hal; I believe the humans have a saying: I have all the time in the world? Yes, that is it...In any case, I do not mind having to wait." And when she asked where his room was, he would point to a door a few spaces down. "Right this way." he would tell her, leading the way to #lonehunters-room .
Avrae BOT 24-Sep-20 10:00 PM

So here he was, angrily walking out if the room, thinking on what to do while Hal was still busy tmwith the other elf's baby.
